audioText: Je ne croyais pas que vous croyiez carrément que cette terre appartenait à votre famille depuis toujours.
question: What didn't the speaker believe?
options: That they really believed the land belonged to their family
That the land was recently purchased
That the family owned multiple properties
That they had legal documents for the land
explanation: The text states 'Je ne croyais pas que vous croyiez carrément que cette terre appartenait à votre famille depuis toujours' - I didn't believe that you really believed that this land belonged to your family forever. 'Croyiez' is the imperfect subjunctive of croire (to believe), 'carrément' means really/completely, and 'terre' means land/earth.
source: Property ownership and family inheritance discussion
